snippet: The operator of the Hunts Point Produce Market, which received $172.5 million to stay in the Bronx, has accused the city’s Business Integrity Commission of interfering with market operations.
abstract: Hunts Point Terminal Produce Cooperative, operator of the Hunts Point Market, which received $172.5 million in cash and tax breaks from New York City to stay in the Bronx, accuses the Business Integrity Commission of interfering with market operations; says agency, created to root out organized crime in the carting industry, has overstepped its mandate by setting operating hours and showering delivery and storage trucks with parking tickets; cooperative says it is ending exclusive negotiations with the city.
lead_paragraph: The operator of the Hunts Point Produce Market, which received $172.5 million to stay in the Bronx, has accused the city’s Business Integrity Commission of interfering with market operations.

headline.seo: Hunts Point Produce Cooperative Says City Commission Is Interfering With Business
headline.main: Hunts Point Market Deal Runs Into a New Obstacle
headline.print_headline: Hunts Point Market Deal Runs Into a New Obstacle
